column4: Howcome it seems that my video settings don't save? (Using Nvidia X Server Settings)
you may need to run the nvidia-settings tool as root via gksudo nvidia-settings
save it to a differnt file, then copy it over to /etc/X11/xorg.conf   is one way
that issue has been fixed in 10.04 i belive. :) *yea*
what language is that even supposed to be in? Its not bash, or anything i recognize
I don't know, I thought I just had to type commands on seperate lines is it like writing C++ is there a format you got to follow?
yes.. actual COMMANDS.. for whatever is exeucting the script.
ie: bash commands if its a bash script
where can I find a newbie guide, I was looking for one for bash but they were all so confusing lol
start small work your way up.. read the abs guide (given above) and bash tutoials
You are just typing random things from what im seeing..
lol, the telnet was supposed to open telnet, then the other commands were supposed to be while inside telnet
if you are scripting a telnet session . theres verys pecific ways to do that.
for such a task 'expect' was developed.
whats Expect a program im guessing?
in gnome - not that ive seen.. in KDE. yes.
i just use the various xrandr tools and the nvidia settings tool
